title.native: 中禅寺先生物怪講義録　先生が謎を解いてしまうから。
title.romaji: Chuuzenji-sensei Mononoke Kougiroku: Sensei ga Nazo wo Toiteshimau kara.

description:
Our setting is in Tokyo in 1948, just right after the war. Kanna Kusakabe had just become a second-year at a high school when she meets the new language teacher, Akihiko Chuuzenji.

Mysterious supernatural things keep happening around Kanna. Once again today, Kanna is going to open the doors to the library prep room to seek help from the surly Chuuzenji-sensei who is waiting inside.

A high school supernatural mystery featuring the unlikely duo between a teacher and a high school girl is about to begin!

(Source: Pony Canyon, edited)
synonyms: The Mononoke Lecture Logs of Chuzenji-sensei: He Just Solves All the Mysteries

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Teacher
tags.description: Protagonist is an educator, usually in a school setting.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

title.native: 中禅寺先生物怪講義録 先生が謎を解いてしまうから。
ちびぜんじ先生 居残り講義録

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/京極夏彦) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Natsuhiko_Kyogoku)

A Japanese mystery writer.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [director](https://anilist.co/staff/235529)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Hiroki_Chura)

The current director of Chura Sound.

__[Artist Profile (MONACA)](http://www.monaca.jp/staff/hirokawa.html)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kayone87)__

__Keiichi Hirokawa__ is a Japanese music composer and arranger who belongs to sound production studio MONACA.

__[Profile (MONACA)](http://www.monaca.jp/staff/takada.html)__

__Ryuuichi Takada__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and member of music unit MONACA. He mainly composes and arranges for videogames, having worked on the soundtracks for Soul Calibur, Tekken, Katamari Damacy, and The iDOLM@STER.

__[Website](http://honeyworks.jp/) | [Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/honeyworks828/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/HoneyWorks_828) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/HoneyWorks56410) | [NicoNico](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/59387)__ __Biography__ HoneyWorks, alternatively known as Haniwa, is a Japanese circle consisting mainly of the composers [Gom](https://anilist.co/staff/147280/Gom) and [shito](https://anilist.co/staff/147276/Shito), and the illustrator [Yamako](https://anilist.co/staff/119761/Yamako). The guitarist [Oji](https://anilist.co/staff/148135) (Kaizoku Ou), the illustrators Rocoru (in 2013) and [Mogelatte](https://anilist.co/staff/121589/Mogelatte), the video producer Ziro and the pianist [cake](https://anilist.co/staff/147555) (the latter three joining in May 2014) are also part of the group as support members. Later on they acquired the drummer Nakanishi in 2017. However, Rocoru graduated from the group in 2019. Some of their most popular songs include "Suki Kirai", "Hatsukoi no Ehon" and "Kokuhaku Yokou Renshuu". Their music style consists mostly of positive rocky songs. In January 2014 they had their first major debut, with the album "Zutto Maekara Suki Deshita.", which ranked in fourth place on Oricon. In May 2014, the start-up of "CHiCO with HoneyWorks" was announced. Sometime in early 2019, the circle began to include subunits: s×c, a duo comprised of shito and cake; and HoneyMonster, comprised of Gom (Kouto), cake, and Nakanishi. The circle also created a number of fictional idols, such as LIP×LIP and Dolce. In addition, ten light novels, based on the Confession Executive Committee Love Series songs "Kokuhaku Yokou Renshuu", "Yakimochi no Kotae", "Hatsukoi no Ehon", "Ima ni Suki Naru.", "Koi-Iro ni Sake", "Kinyoubi no Ohayou", "Heart no Shuchou", "Ijiwaru na Deai", "Boku ga Namae wo Yobu Hi", and "Daikirai na Hazu Datta." have been released so far. A short novella about the song "Watashi, Idol Sengen" was also included with a CHiCO with Honeyworks album. Light novels for HoneyWorks' other songs do exist as well; the Love and Hate Trilogy ("Nakimushi Kareshi", "Suki-Kirai", "Hajimari no Sayonara") and "Sekai wa Koi ni Ochiteiru" and its sequel "Koi no Chord" both received one.

__Residency:__ Tokyo, Japan

__[Profile (Kamitsubaki Studio)](http://kamitsubaki.jp/artist/kaf/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/virtual_kaf) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/virtual_kaf/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCQ1U65-CQdIoZ2_NA4Z4F7A) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@virtual_kaf) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/2c32JruIkUyfdycHmhIph4)__

__Kaf__ is a virtual Japanese singer affiliated and managed by Kamitsubaki Studio. She has been uploading original songs and covers to YouTube, Instagram, and TikTok since October 2018. All of her original songs were provided by [Iori Kanzaki](https://anilist.co/staff/180461/Iori-Kanzaki) until 2023, and her character designer is [PALOW](https://anilist.co/staff/306406/PALOW).

__[Website](http://honeyworks.jp/) | [Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/honeyworks828/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/HoneyWorks_828) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/HoneyWorks56410) | [NicoNico](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/59387)__ __Biography__ HoneyWorks, alternatively known as Haniwa, is a Japanese circle consisting mainly of the composers [Gom](https://anilist.co/staff/147280/Gom) and [shito](https://anilist.co/staff/147276/Shito), and the illustrator [Yamako](https://anilist.co/staff/119761/Yamako). The guitarist [Oji](https://anilist.co/staff/148135) (Kaizoku Ou), the illustrators Rocoru (in 2013) and [Mogelatte](https://anilist.co/staff/121589/Mogelatte), the video producer Ziro and the pianist [cake](https://anilist.co/staff/147555) (the latter three joining in May 2014) are also part of the group as support members. Later on they acquired the drummer Nakanishi in 2017. However, Rocoru graduated from the group in 2019. Some of their most popular songs include "Suki Kirai", "Hatsukoi no Ehon" and "Kokuhaku Yokou Renshuu". Their music style consists mostly of positive rocky songs. In January 2014 they had their first major debut, with the album "Zutto Maekara Suki Deshita.", which ranked in fourth place on Oricon. In May 2014, the start-up of "CHiCO with HoneyWorks" was announced. Website | Twitter | Facebook | Instagram __Shihori Nakane__, alternatively known as Shihori, is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and arranger.

__[Website](http://honeyworks.jp/) | [Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/honeyworks828/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/HoneyWorks_828) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/HoneyWorks56410) | [NicoNico](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/59387)__ __Biography__ HoneyWorks, alternatively known as Haniwa, is a Japanese circle consisting mainly of the composers [Gom](https://anilist.co/staff/147280/Gom) and [shito](https://anilist.co/staff/147276/Shito), and the illustrator [Yamako](https://anilist.co/staff/119761/Yamako).
